Description: This CloudFormation template creates the environment-specific shared infrastructure (S3 buckets, Lambda functions, Data Pipeline, Redshift Data Warehouse).

KeypairParameter.Description: Keypair to install on DownloadVerify EC2 and EMR EC2s

DownloadVerifyLambdaCodeObjectParameter.Description: Name of ZIP file in the CodeS3Bucket containing the DowloadVerifyLambda function code

DownloadVerifyAWSDataToolsJARLocationPar.Description: Name of JAR file in the CodeS3Bucket containing the DownloadVerifyAWSDataTools JAR code

DownloadVerifySchemaJARLocationParameter.Description: Prefix of JAR file (up until the version number) in the CodeS3Bucket containing the DownloadVerifySchema JAR code

DownloadVerifyPythonScriptLocationParame.Description: Name of Python file in the CodeS3Bucket containing the DownloadVerify Python script

DownloadVerifySecurePropertiesLocationPa.Description: Name of secure settings file for use by DownloadVerify Python script (NOTE: Name must remain secure.properties for now)

HiveCreateScriptLocationParameter.Description: Prefix of the .q file (up until the version number) in the CodeS3Bucket containing the Hive Create script

HiveCopyScriptLocationParameter.Description: Prefix of the .q file (up until the version number) in the CodeS3Bucket containing the Hive Copy script

HiveQueryScriptLocationParameter.Description: Name of the .q file in the CodeS3Bucket containing the Hive Query script

HadoopJARLocationParameter.Description: Name of JAR file in the CodeS3Bucket containing the Hadoop JAR code

CodeS3BucketParameter.Description: Name of S3 bucket containing various Lambda, JAR and Hadoop code files

DataPipelineInitLambdaCodeObjectParamete.Description: Name of ZIP file in the CodeS3Bucket containing the DataPipelineInitLambda function code

S3toRedshiftLoaderParameter.Description: Prefix of the SQL file (up until the version number) in the CodeS3Bucket containing the Redshift SQL code to move data from S3 to Redshift after Data Pipeline processing

SuccessSNSEmailParameter.Description: Email address to receive success messages

FailureSNSEmailParameter.Description: Email address to receive failure messages

RedshiftMasterUserNameParameter.Description: Redshift master user (and default db) name

PublicSubnetParameter.Description: Public subnet for the EMR Cluster

PublicSubnetCidrParameter.Description: Public subnet CIDR block for the EMR Cluster

PrivateSubnetParameter.Description: Private subnet for the DownloadVerify EC2 and the EMR Cluster

PrivateSubnetCidrParameter.Description: Private subnet CIDR block for the DownloadVerify EC2 and the EMRCluster

VPNCidrParameter.Description: CIDR block for our internal VPN (to allow access to Redshift from our VPN)

DownloadVerifyAMIIdParameter.Description: AMI Id to use for the DownloadVerify Instance(s) (NOTE: Should be instance store AMI, not EBS, for maximum speed)

EMRMasterInstanceTypeParameter.Description: Instance type for the Master EMR Instance

EMRCoreInstanceTypeParameter.Description: Instance type for Core EMR Instance(s)

EMRTaskInstanceTypeParameter.Description: Instance type for Task EMR Instance(s)

EMRReleaseLabelParameter.Description: EMR release label to be used

Fn::Join: # DownloadVerifySecureProperties from S3 to the local FS
# Run the Python/JAR download and verify scripts
# do something useful to indicate failure
# Reduce max instances for this machine's ASG to 0, thus terminating the machine

asg=$(aws ec2 describe-tags --filters "Name=resource-id,Values=$(curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/instance-id)" "Name=key,Values=aws:autoscaling:groupName" --query 'Tags[*].[Value]' --output text --region us-east-1); aws autoscaling update-auto-scaling-group --auto-scaling-group-name $asg --max-size 0 --region us-east-1
# Create a SQLActivity script for the upcoming Data Pipeline that is customized for this data set
# NOTE: It would have been preferrable to have a generic script which accepts scriptArguments,
#       but after much troubleshooting, that appeared to be impossible, so this approach was created.
# Credit for the following grep magic goes to http://stackoverflow.com/a/20488535
# Get the path to the data files in the intermediate S3 bucket, assign to env variable
# Get the data set number, assign to env variable
# Replace <intermediates3bucketandpath> placeholder with real intermediate bucket name and path
# Copy modified file to code S3 bucket, name it with data set number.
# Send an email that we completed download and verify
# Invoke the Lambda function to kickoff the Data Pipeline
# Reduce max instances for this machine's ASG to 0, thus terminating the machine

asg=$(aws ec2 describe-tags --filters "Name=resource-id,Values=$(curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/instance-id)" "Name=key,Values=aws:autoscaling:groupName" --query 'Tags[*].[Value]' --output text --region us-east-1); aws autoscaling update-auto-scaling-group --auto-scaling-group-name $asg --max-size 0 --region us-east-1
Function to kick off download and verify for
Function to kick off Data Pipeline for
Dataset dataset-id-placeholder - Move Data to HDFS succeeded
Dataset dataset-id-placeholder - Move Data to HDFS failed
Dataset dataset-id-placeholder - Hive Create Tables succeeded
Dataset dataset-id-placeholder - Hive Create Tables failed
Dataset dataset-id-placeholder - Move Data from HDFS succeeded
Dataset dataset-id-placeholder - Move Data from HDFS failed
Dataset dataset-id-placeholder - Move data to archives succeeded
Datatset dataset-id-placeholder - Move dataset to archives failed

Fields.StringValue: dpid=$(aws ec2 describe-tags --filters "Name=resource-id,Values=$(curl http://169.254.169.254/latest/meta-data/instance-id)" "Name=key,Values=datapipeline-id" --query 'Tags[*].[Value]' --output text --region us-east-1); aws datapipeline delete-pipeline --pipeline-id $dpid --region us-east-1
